+---------+---------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **n**   | Sodic         | To denote an accumulation of sodium (identified in the field).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
+---------+---------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **q**   | Silicic       | To denote an accumulation of secondary silica. A [duripan](nzsc_diagnostics.qmd#sec-diag-dpan) is designated **q**.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
+---------+---------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **v**   | Variegated    | To denote a horizon with mottles or variegated colour pattern due to differential weathering of mineral components and not attributable to reduction and segregation of iron caused by saturation with water.                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
+---------+---------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **y**   | Gypsic        | To denote an accumulation of gypsum, CaSO~4~.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
+---------+---------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **x**   | Fragic        | To denote a horizon with [fragipan](nzsc_diagnostics.qmd#sec-diag-fpan) properties, usually **BCxg**, **BCx(g)** or **BCx**.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|         |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|         |               | A fragipan must fulfil ALL of the following requirements:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|         |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|         |               | i.  An air-dried clod slakes when fully immersed in water.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|         |               | ii. It has brittle [failure](milne_consistence.qmd#sec_cons_fail) when moist. The horizon may contain rock fragments, but the fine earth must be sufficiently coherent to allow brittle fracture.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|         |               | iii. It has at least slightly firm moist soil [strength](milne_consistence.qmd#sec-sons-str).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|         |               | iv. Either                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|         |               |     a.  Extremely coarse or gross [prismatic](milne_structure.qmd#sec-str-shp) peds: the prisms have apedal-massive interiors, or break to secondary peds with horizontal dimensions of 100 mm or more, and the prism faces are defined by colours of chroma 3 or less, *or*                                                                                                                                          |
|         |               |     b.  The horizon is apedal-massive throughout, or has extremely coarse or gross prismatic peds, and the moist soil [strength](milne_consistence.qmd#sec-sons-str) is very firm.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|         |               | v.  If roots are present, they are confined predominantly to planar voids between prisms or to worm galleries.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|         |               | vi. Moist penetration resistance measured by a 6.5 mm flat-tipped penetrometer is 3100 kPa or more.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|         |               | vii. It does not occur within an **E** horizon.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|         |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|         |               | A fragipan usually has [clay coatings](milne_macrofabric.qmd#sec-surf) on fissures or in pores between fissures. Their presence is not indicated by an additional suffix **t**. Likewise, the use of the additional suffix **p** with **g** or **(g)** to denote perched water is superfluous.                                                                                                                        |
+---------+---------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **(x)** | Almost fragic | To denote a brittle horizon that does not meet all the requirements of a [fragipan](nzsc_diagnostics.qmd#sec-diag-fpan), e.g. **Bw(x)**.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
+---------+---------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **z**   | Salty         | To denote an accumulation of salts more soluble than gypsum.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
+---------+---------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

### Prefixes

-   [**b**]{style="color: red"} may be used to signify the presence of a paleosol, where pedologically altered materials have been buried.
-   numbers [**1**-***N***]{style="color: red"} may be used to signify lithological discontinuities, where the parent material changes significantly between layers e.g. 2C
-   Number and b prefixes may be combined to describe multiple instances of buried soils and discontinuities, although this is somewhat rare in the top 100 cm.

## Internal Drainage

Soil internal drainage is an assessment of how fast water leaves a soil profile in relation to supply. This characteristic can be controlled by morphological characteristics that occur in a range of combinations.

Internal drainage should first be assessed on a per-horizon basis. These interpretations are later summarised at a profile level. @tbl-in-intdrng summarises the common characteristics associated with each horizon drainage class. A 'balance of evidence' approach should be taken when assigning a class to a horizon. When in doubt, choose the poorest class available.

```{r}
#| label: tbl-in-intdrng
#| tbl-cap: "Internal drainage - horizon characteristics"
#| column: page

dat_in_intdrng <-
  tribble(~Code, ~Name, ~HNames, ~sws, ~mcol, ~Mottles, ~Texture, ~StrGr, ~secfts, ~cons, ~Roots, ~voids,
          'VP', 'Very poor', 'O*, *r', 'Saturated or wet', 'Dark or gley', 'None to Few (<10%)', 'Peaty, clayey, silty. Rarely sandy, very rarely stony', 'Apedal', 'Few to None', 'Deformable', 'None', 'None',
          'PO', 'Poor', '*r, *g', 'Wet', 'Dark, gley or grey', 'None to Few (<10%)', 'Clayey, silty, occasionally peaty and more often just highly organic (e.g. drained ex-peat). Rarely sandy, very rarely stony', 'Apedal to weak', 'Few to none', 'Deformable or semi-deformable',  'Few to None', 'Few',
          'SP', 'Somewhat Poor', '*g', 'Wet to moist', 'Dark, grey, yellow or pale', 'Few to Many (10% - 50%)', 'Any', 'Apedal to moderate', 'Nodules and/or pans', 'Brittle to semi-deformable', 'Few to common', 'Fine only',
          'IP', 'Imperfect', '*(g)', 'Moist to slightly moist', 'Dark, grey, yellow or pale', 'Many to Profuse (50 - >75%)', 'Any',  'Apedal to moderate', 'Nodules and/or pans', 'Friable to semi-deformable', 'Few to common', 'Few to common',
          'MW', 'Moderately Well', '*(f)', 'Moist to Dry', 'Any non-gley', 'Very Few (<2%) and non-gley', 'Variable but usually not clayey', 'Any', 'Nodules', 'Very friable to brittle',  'Common to Many', 'Common to Many',
          'WE', 'Well', 'No redox suffixes', 'Moist to Dry', 'Any non-gley', 'None', 'Variable but usually not clayey', 'Any', 'Few to None', 'Very friable to brittle', 'Common to Many', 'Common to Many')

tbl_in_intdrng <- gt(dat_in_intdrng) |>
   tab_options(
    column_labels.font.weight = 'bold', 
    heading.title.font.weight = 'bold',
    table.align = 'center',
    table.width = '85%'
  ) |>
  tab_style(style = list(cell_text(color = 'red', weight = 'bold')),
            locations = cells_body(columns = 1)) |>

tbl_in_intdrng
```

## External drainage

External drainage, or runoff, focuses on how surface water behaves at the point of observation - to what extent and speed it infiltrates the profile.
